In disastrous drought, a grim milestone: state could see its first big reservoir run dry

State officials are working with water managers in Sonoma and Mendocino counties to try to prevent Lake Mendocino from running out of water. Despite recent rains, the upper Russian River watershed and its primary reservoir are a long way from recovering from drought.

How Belcampo’s sudden downfall rippled through the sustainable meat industry

Belcampo’s meat mislabeling scandal and sudden closure last month sent shock waves through the sustainable meat industry. Bay Area butchers say they’re disappointed but not surprised that Belcampo’s rapid growth and ambitious business model would be challenging to sustain in an industry with slim margins.
